Indications and doses

Local treatment of infections,

To the eye

  • For adults
    Apply every 2–4 hours for the first 2 days, then reduced to 4 times a day for maximum 10 days treatment.
  • For children 1–17 years
    Apply every 2–4 hours for the first 2 days, then reduced to 4 times a day for maximum 10 days treatment.

Urinary-tract infections,

By mouth

  • For adults
    200–400 mg daily, preferably taken in the morning; increased if necessary to 400 mg twice daily, in upper urinary tract infections.

Complicated urinary-tract infection,

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    200 mg dailyIncreased to 400 mg twice daily, for severe or complicated infections, to be given over at least 30 minutes for each 200 mg.

Acute or chronic prostatitis,

By mouth

  • For adults
    200 mg twice daily for 28 days.

Lower respiratory-tract infections,

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    400 mg daily, dose preferably taken in the morning, then increased if necessary to 400 mg twice daily.
  • For adults
    200 mg twice daily. increased to 400 mg twice daily, for severe or complicated infections. To be given over at least 30 minutes for each 200 mg.

Skin and soft-tissue infections,

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    400 mg twice daily.
  • For adults
    400 mg twice daily, to be given over at least 30 minutes for each 200 mg.

Uncomplicated gonorrhoea,

By mouth

  • For adults
    400 mg once daily as a single dose.

Uncomplicated genital chlamydial infection, Non-gonococcal urethritis,

By mouth

  • For adults
    400 mg daily for 7 days, dose may be taken as a single daily dose or in divided doses.

Pelvic inflammatory disease,

By mouth

  • For adults
    400 mg twice daily for 14 days.

Septicaemia,

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    200 mg twice daily. increased to 400 mg twice daily, for severe or complicated infections. To be given over at least 30 minutes for each 200 mg.

Advice when patient is pregnant

When used by eye

Manufacturer advises use only if benefit outweighs risk (systemic quinolones have caused arthropathy in animal studies).

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

With intravenous use or oral use in adults

Use with caution; elimination may be reduced in severe impairment.

Advice regarding renal impairment

With intravenous use or oral use in adults

Usual initial dose, then use half normal dose if eGFR 20–50 mL/minute/1.73 m2; 100 mg every 24 hours if eGFR less than 20 mL/ minute/1.73 m2

Advice for patients and carers

Cautions regarding administration

  • When used by eye: corneal ulcer (risk of corneal perforation)
  • When used by eye: epithelial defect (risk of corneal perforation)
  • With intravenous use: acute myocardial infarction (risk factor for QT interval prolongation) in adults
  • With intravenous use: bradycardia (risk factor for QT interval prolongation) in adults
  • With intravenous use: congenital long QT syndrome (risk factor for QT interval prolongation) in adults
  • With intravenous use: electrolyte disturbances (risk factor for QT interval prolongation) in adults
  • With intravenous use: heart failure with reduced left ventricular ejection fraction (risk factor for QT interval prolongation) in adults
  • With intravenous use: history of psychiatric illness in adults
  • With intravenous use: history of symptomatic arrhythmias (risk factor for QT interval prolongation) in adults
  • With oral use: acute myocardial infarction (risk factor for QT interval prolongation) in adults
  • With oral use: bradycardia (risk factor for QT interval prolongation) in adults
  • With oral use: congenital long QT syndrome (risk factor for QT interval prolongation) in adults
  • With oral use: electrolyte disturbances (risk factor for QT interval prolongation) in adults
  • With oral use: heart failure with reduced left ventricular ejection fraction (risk factor for QT interval prolongation) in adults
  • With oral use: history of psychiatric illness in adults
  • With oral use: history of symptomatic arrhythmias (risk factor for QT interval prolongation) in adults
